trustfund:
TF025957-PHRD-BRAZIL: FAMILY HEALTH AND
            BASIC HEALTH CARE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Brazil Health Extension Program
            Project (FHEP), an operation under an Adaptable Lending
            Instrument (APL) in three phases of three, two and two years
            each, seeks to improve utilization and quality of
            publicly-financed health services. The project has three
            main components. The first component expands coverage of the
            government's Family Health Program (Programa de Saude
            da Familia, or PSF) in about 100 large municipalities,
            establishing well-articulated referral and counter-referral
            systems, and introducing performance-based financing and
            management arrangements. The second component establishes
            family health as a core element of health professional and
            para-professional training. The third component strengthens
            the health ministry's capacity to monitor and evaluate
            PSF health services, policies, and training activities on a
            systematic basis.
